avalancheActivity.comment: An avalanche released onto the hiking path on Esja this weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: New snow is in the mountains after SW snow showers and strong winds and wind slabs can be expected in gullies and leeward slopes.

snowpackStructure.highlights: New snow has accumulated in the mountains after the southwesterly blizzard in recent days. Wind slabs have formed widely on leeward slopes, in gullies, and depressions, and they are expected to be unstable at first. Continued snow showers in the coming days will further increase wind slab formation in the mountains, but warmer temperatures on Thursday will likely strengthen the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: In recent days, there has been significant snowfall in strong southwesterly winds in the mountains, especially in the southern and western parts of the country as well as the central highlands. Wind slabs are therefore widespread and may be unstable. On Thursday, warmer temperatures are expected in the southern and western parts of the country, likely strengthening the snowpack in the lower elevations. On Friday, it will get colder again with light snow showers and lighter winds, but the wind directions shift to a northerly wind over the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: "In recent days, there has been significant snowfall in strong southwesterly winds in the mountains, in southern and western parts as well as the central highlands. Wind slabs may be unstable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi SV-éljagangur aðfaranótt fimmtudags en síðan hlýnar á fimmudag með slyddu og rigningu á láglendi og éljum til fjalla. Á föstudag kólnar aftur og éljar áfram í SV-átt en útlit er fyrir að snúist í norðanátt yfir helgina.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches have crossed the road in Súðavíkurhlíð ande Gemlufallsheiði
avalancheActivity.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in the mountains after southwesterly snow showers and strong winds. Increased wind slab formation is expected until the weekend, and the avalanche danger is likely to increase accordingly.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Wind slabs are widespread in the mountains after strong southwesterly snow showers in recent days. Further wind slab formation is expected with continued southwesterly winds until the weekend.

travelAdvisory.comment: In recent days, there has been significant snowfall in strong southwesterly winds in the mountains, especially in the southern and western parts of the country as well as the central highlands. Wind slabs are therefore widespread and may be unstable. On Thursday, warmer temperatures are expected in the southern and western parts of the country, likely strengthening the snowpack in the lower elevations. On Friday, it will get colder again with light snow showers and lighter winds, but the wind directions shift to a northerly wind over the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: "In recent days, there has been significant snowfall in strong southwesterly winds in the mountains, in southern and western parts as well as the central highlands. Wind slabs may be unstable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Gert er ráð fyrir áframhaldandi SV-éljagangi fram að helgi og töluverðri snjósöfnun til fjalla. Á föstudag éljar lítillega en hægir á vindi sem snýst síðan í N-átt aðfaranótt laugardags.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier remotely triggered an avalanche in Þverfell by Sandaskarð in Svarfaðardalur.
avalancheActivity.highlights: SW wind with snowshowers in the next few days so small wind slabs could form on NE aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It thawed a bit on Monday but blowing snow was in the area at very high elevations. Snowshowers in the next few days during strong SW wind. Windslabs are present at high elevations, especially in gullies and bowls and snowfall and blowing snow could form more slabs, especially on N-E aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: In recent days, there has been significant snowfall in strong southwesterly winds in the mountains, especially in the southern and western parts of the country as well as the central highlands. Wind slabs are therefore widespread and may be unstable. On Thursday, warmer temperatures are expected in the southern and western parts of the country, likely strengthening the snowpack in the lower elevations. On Friday, it will get colder again with light snow showers and lighter winds, but the wind directions shift to a northerly wind over the weekend.
travelAdvisory.highlights: "In recent days, there has been significant snowfall in strong southwesterly winds in the mountains, in southern and western parts as well as the central highlands. Wind slabs may be unstable.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hvöss SV-átt með dálitlum éljum næstu daga. Kólnar í veðri.

avalancheActivity.comment: Small avalanches released in Oddsskarð on Friday last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Old and stable snow in most places but possibly some thin windslabs high in the mountains.

snowpackStructure.highlights: It snowed last week onto hard packed snow with some blowing snow. Small and thin windslabs formed likely on most aspects. Especially at high elevations or in gullies. The old snow is stiff in most places but with some layering at high elevations but considered mostly stable. Some snowfall in SW-winds expected.

travelAdvisory.comment: In recent days, there has been significant snowfall in strong southwesterly winds in the mountains, especially in the southern and western parts of the country as well as the central highlands. Wind slabs are therefore widespread and may be unstable. On Thursday, warmer temperatures are expected in the southern and western parts of the country, likely strengthening the snowpack in the lower elevations. On Friday, it will get colder again with light snow showers and lighter winds, but the wind directions shift to a northerly wind over the weekend.

weatherForecast.highlights: S-V-áttir næstu daga og líkur á snjókomu með köflum. Hvasst af og til og hiti í kringum frostmark á láglendi. Hægari vindur þegar líður að helgi.
